poem:
The Market of Life

In quiet corners, clicks echo,  
Where souls barter unspoken dreams.  
Rod, with bold claims,  
Casts seeds across digital voids.  
Not the sterile hum of machines,  
But a human heart's pulse,  
A marketplace of origins,  
Where longing weaves  
With the fabric of tomorrow's whispers.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘They treat men like vending machines’: Inside the hidden world of social media sperm selling A man going by the name “Rod Kissme” claims to have “very strong sperm”. It may seem like an eccentric boast for a Facebook profile page, but then this is no mundane corner of the internet. The group where Rod and other men advertise themselves is a community where women and couples come, in many cases, to fulfil a lifelong". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
